{"title":"page 9","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"Sec. 4. They shall yield implicit obedience to
all lawful orders which they may receive from the
persons in authority over them.
Sec. 5. No person shall be permitted to remain
in the several Police Station Houses without express permission from the officer in charge, except
members of the department and persons on busi-
Sec. 6. The use of Spiritous Liquors in the
Police Station Houses is expressly forbidden, nor
is it permitted to any policeman on Duty to enter
a Coffee House or Cabaret, unless in the immediate discharge of his duties. Policemen are required to be quiet and orderly, and are expressly
forbidden to use any obscene or improper language
while in or about the Station Houses.
Sec. 7. Members of the department shall not
accept from any person while in custody, or after
he shall have been discharged, nor from any of his
friends, any gratuity, reward or present, nor shall
they receive from any person (without the written
permission of the Mayor) compensation for damages sustained in the discharge of their duty.
Sec. 8. A perfect command of temper is a
qualification essentially necessary to a policeman,","fullrs":{},"find":"2648.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2647","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"490361","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.47 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
